text: Jan, 3.US, UK, Russia, France, and China adopted a joint statement to prevent a nuclear war.
event: The US, UK, Russia, France, and China have adopted a joint statement aimed at preventing a nuclear war

text: Jan,13. EU extends sanctions against Russia for failure to comply with peace settlement agreements with Ukraine
event: The European Union is extending sanctions on Russia for another six months for failing to meet its commitments to the Ukrainian peace deal.
Decription: The measures target Russia’s financial, energy and defense sectors, as well as goods that can be used for both civilian and military purposes. The move is part of an ongoing review and is not linked to current tensions over Russia’s military buildup near Ukraine.

text: Jan, 17. EU and US move away from excluding Russia from global financial system: Germany insists on exemptions so that payment for gas and oil imports from Russia remains possible.
Feb, 19. Russian Communist Party faction submitted to the State Duma a draft appeal to Vladimir Putin on the recognition of the DPR and LPR
event: The Communist Party faction submitted to the State Duma a draft appeal to Vladimir Putin on the recognition of the DPR and LPR

text: Jan, 20. Officials in Berlin has ruled out sending weapons to Ukraine
Jan, 20. U.S. assesses Russian retaliation potential should it be cut from SWIFT -senator

Jan, 23. Biden administration is threatening to use a novel export control to damage strategic Russian industries, from artificial intelligence and quantum computing to civilian aerospace, if Moscow invades Ukraine
Jan, 31. Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin signed a joint statement calling on the West to “abandon the ideologised approaches of the cold war”
event: Putin visited China, negotiation with Xi

text: Feb, 15. The State Duma of Russia voted "FOR" an appeal to President Putin with a request to recognize the DPR and LPR
event: The State Duma of Russia voted "FOR" an appeal to President Putin with a request to recognize the DNR and LNR
Decription: The State Duma of Russia voted "FOR" an appeal to President Putin with a request to recognize the DNR and LNR

text: Feb, 15. Vladimir Putin called the events taking place in the Donbas a genocide after conversation with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz
event: Putin called the events taking place in the Donbas a genocide

text: Feb, 18. In eastern Ukraine, it was announces evacuation of residents to Russia
event: Evacuation from Donetsk to Russia

text: Feb,19. Zelenkiy mentioned that Ukraine could reconsider its non-nuclear status at the Munich Security Conference.
event: Zelensky speech at the Munich Security Conference
Decription: Zelenky mentioned that Ukraine could reconsider the non-nuclear status

event: Start of general mobilisation in the DNR
Decription: The general mobilization in Donbass started. "LPR" introduced a wartime regime

text: Mar, 21. Russian President Vladimir Putin has recognized the independence of two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine - LNR and DNR
event: Russia recognized the independence of the DNR and LNR
Decription: Russian President Vladimir Putin orders troops into the regions of Luhansk and Donetsk, and recognises them as independent states.

text: Feb, 21. Sanctions Wave #1 for recognition of separatist enclaves: NordStream 2, defence industry, MPs, propagandists
event: First round of sanctions is introduced in connection with the recognition of the DNR and LNR: Sanctions against the defense industry, Nord Stream 2, personal sanctions against MPs, propagandists and others.

text: Feb, 22. The federal government of Germany has put the approval process for the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline on hold until further notice.

Feb, 24.  President Putin announced the start of a "special military operation in the Donbass. 
Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine have started.
event: Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine
Decription:
05:00 On the night of February 24, Russian President Vladimir Putin announced the start of a "special military operation in the Donbass. 

Battle of Chernobyl,  
nuclear power plant capture
Airstrikes against Odesa
Железнодорожные пути и мост через Припять были взорваны
Бои за Сумы
Бои на Змеинном острове

text: Feb, 24. Sanctions Wave #2 for the invasion of Ukraine: personal, banking, investments

event: Antiwar Protests in Russia began
Fighting in Ukraine
Decription:
Russian detachments enter the northern region of Kyiv Obolon. Sirens in Kyiv
Chernihiv was surrounded by Russian military
The first clashes between Ukrainian troops and Russian special forces took place in Bucha
In Mykolaiv, Russian troops capture enterprised. Residents confirm that shooting has begun in the city.
Fightings for Melitopol have started
Bombing of Sumy
Night fighting near Kyiv
 Russia vetoes a United Nations Security Council resolution demanding that it unconditionally pull its troops out of Ukraine.

text: Feb, 26. Sanctions Wave #3: personal, banking, stock exchange, industrial, mass media, partial airspace and ports closure
event: Third round of sanctions is introduced: banking, stock exchange and industrial restrictions, banning of Russian media, partial closure of skies, ports, personal sanctions.

text: Feb, 26. US, EU, UK, Canada announced disconnection of several banks from SWIFT
event: U.S., E.U., U.K. and Canada have announced the disconnection of a number of banks from Swift
Russian troops captured the Port of Berdiansk
Decription: Russian troops captured the Port of Berdiansk and the Berdiansk Airport. By the following day, the Russian military had taken full control of the city. The city still on russian occupation

text: Feb,26. Germany's Chancellor, Olaf Scholz, has announced that Germany will deliver weapons directly to Ukraine.
Feb, 27. The EU is set to enforce a ban on Russia’s access to the SWIFT international payments system after the last holdout among the EU27, Germany, dropped its opposition in principle
Decription: Russian troops press towards three cities, Kyiv, Kharkiv and Kherson. European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen says Russian civilian aircraft are banned from EU airspace, and Russian state-owned media Russia Today, Sputnik and their subsidiaries are banned from EU airwaves and the internet.

event: attacks on the civilian airport of Zhytomyr
Decription: The airport is situated around 150 kilometres (93 mi) from the capital city of Ukraine, Kyiv, near the town of Zhytomyr, Zhytomyr Oblast.

event: Kharkiv cluster bombing
Decription: Around 10:00 AM, the Russian Army fired Grad rockets into three different residential areas in Kharkiv. A series of rocket strikes  killed 9 civilians and wounded 37 more during the battle of Kharkiv, part of the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine. The Russian Army used cluster munition in the attack.

text: Feb,28. Negotiations between Ukraine and Russia started in Belarus
Mar, 1. Siege of Mariupol have started. It was announced that DPR forces has almost completely surrounded the nearby cities and Mariupol.
event: Start of the Mariupol siege
Decription: Russian forces surround Mariupol. The siege was conitinued until May 22, including Azovstal siege. The siege of Mariupol was accompanied by thousands of civilians, the lack of water, gas, food, and humanitarian corridors.

event: Russian forces attack a TV tower in Kyiv

text: Mar, 2. Russian military took control of city of Kherson, administrative centre of Kherson Oblast
event: Kherson under control of russian forces
Decription: Mayor of Kherson Kolykhaiev announced that he had surrendered the city and that the Russian commander intended to set up a military administration. Kolykhaiev acknowledged the Ukrainian military was no longer present in Kherson. After the fall of the city, Kherson and the Kherson Oblast came under a Russian military occupation.

text: Mar, 3. EU disconnects 7 Russian banks from SWIFT
event: EU names 7 banks to be disconnected from Swift
Bombing of Chernihiv
Decription: About 12:15 p.m. local time, Russian forces destroyed two schools and several apartment blocks in Chernihiv, killing 47 civilians and wounding 18

event: The law about "fakes" was accepted
Decription: Vladimir Putin signed a law criminalizing dissemination of information about the actions of the Russian army that does not correspond to the position of the authorities

event: Fire at the seized Zaporizhzhia NPP
Decription:
At the beginning of March 2022, Russian troops seized Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia NPP. On March 4, mutual shelling caused a fire at the plant.
Most of the Russian fire was directed towards the training center and main administrative building, but Russian forces also fired heavy weapons in the direction of the reactor buildings multiple times. During approximately two hours of heavy fighting a fire broke out in a training facility outside of the main complex, which was extinguished by 6:20 am

text: Mar, 5. Russian forces shell evacuation corridor from Mariupol.
event: Russian forces shell evacuation corridor from Mariupol.
Decription: A five-hour ceasefire was declared, but evacuations were quickly halted after shelling continued during the declared time. On 7 March, the ICRC announced that it had found that one of the routes listed for evacuations during a ceasefire had been mined.

event: Bucha under control of russian forces
Decription: Since 5 to 31 March, Bucha, city in tKyiv region, was under contol of Russian forcses. After they left the city, the was a found a lot of corpses of civilians on the streets and mass graves.

event: Irpin refugee column shelling
Decription: from 9:30 a.m. until 2 p.m. local time, the Russian Armed Forces repeatedly shelled an intersection in Irpin that hundreds of civilians were using to escape to Kyiv, whilst a Ukrainian artillery position was located nearby. They killed eight Ukrainian civilians.

event: Ukraine accuses Russia of shelling Mariupol evacuation corridor
Izium hospital bombing
Decription: Russian forces bombed a hospital in Izium, which was totally destroyed

text: Mar, 9.The Russian Air Force bombed Maternity Hospital No 3, a hospital complex functioning both as a children's hospital and maternity ward in Mariupol.
event: Mariupol hospital airstrike
Decription: On 9 March 2022, the Russian Air Force bombed Maternity Hospital No 3, a hospital complex functioning both as a children's hospital and maternity ward in Mariupol, Ukraine. Foreign Minister of the Russian Federation Sergey Lavrov, without denying the shelling of the hospital by Russian troops, said that the hospital building served as a stronghold for the Ukrainian regiment "Azov"

text: Mar, 9. Personal sanctions against russian fertilizer billionnaire Andrey Melnichenko
event: Personal sanctions against russian fertilizer billionnaire Andrey Melnichenko
Decription: Among those hit with sanctions, which include asset freezes and a travel ban, is Andrey Melnichenko, who has built a fortune in fertilizer and coal worth $16.2 billion, by Forbes’ estimate.

text: Mar, 9. Statement on the possible nationalization of foreign companies' assets
event: Statement on the possibility of nationalizing the assets of foreign companies
Decription: Russian officials have said that they will move to nationalize the assets of Western companies that pull out of their country over its invasion of Ukraine, a decision that will cause significant economic harm to hundreds of businesses while, at least temporarily, preserving the jobs of the tens of thousands of Russians employed by them.

event: Rape
Decription: Russian soldier had killed an unarmed civilian and then repeatedly raped his wife.The incident is supposed to have taken place on 9 March in Shevchenkove

event: Обесточение Чернобольской АЭС
Decription: уточнить. На хранилище отработанного ядерного топлива – 1 хранится около 20 тысяч отработанных топливных сборок. Они нуждаются в постоянном охлаждении, которое возможно только при наличии электроснабжения. Если же его не будет и насосы не будут производить охлаждение, возрастет температура в бассейнах выдержки, возникнет парение и выход радиоактивных веществ в окружающую среду.

text: March,10. The Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation published documents on the implementation of US military biological programs in Ukraine
event: Russian forces found biolaboratories in Ukraine
First step Ukraine-Russia negotiations
Decription: The top diplomats of Russia and Ukraine met in Antalya, Turkey for face-to-face talks, the first high-level contact since Russia’s invasion on February 24. No progress was made.

A day after coal and fertilizer billionaire Andrey Melnichenko was placed on the European Union's sanctions list on March 9, his superyacht Motor Yacht A stopped broadcasting its location while in Maldives' waters, maritime data shows.

event: United States, European Union, and G7 to Announce Further Economic Costs on Russia
In Chernihiv, Russian military bombs destroyed the stadium named after. Yuri Gagarin
Decription:
Since the invasion have started, there was fighting between Russian and Ukrainian armed forces for control of the city of Chernihiv. It ended on April 6, 2022 with the withdrawal of Russian troops from the Chernihiv region.  
in addition to this event, Chernihiv was heavily damaged and civilians also died during the invasion.

event: Mykolaiv cluster bombing
Decription: Nine civilians waiting in line on the street at a cash machine were killed in the attack. The explosions also damaged houses and civilian buildings. Human Rights Watch analysed the incident and found that the Russian forces used Smerch and Uragan cluster munition on densely populated areas

event: A fourth round of talks between Ukraine and Russia concluded without a breakthrough
Russian occupying forces block people's protests in Melitopol
Decription: Fighting in Melitopol continued from the beginning of the invasion on 24 February. In early March, the city was captured by the Russian military, and the Russian flag was raised over the administration. All this time, residents of the city went out to peaceful protests against the Russian authorities. On March 11, the mayor of the city was kidnapped by the Russian military. Now the city is under the control of the Russian military

text: Mar, 15. Sanctions Wave #4: personal, investment, export, import, transport, trade privileges
event: Fourth round of sanctions introduced. Removal of trade privileges, investment, export, import, transport, personal sanctions.

text: Mar, 15. Russia Enacts Partial Ban on Grain Exports
event: Russia Enacts Partial Ban on Grain Exports
Decription: Russia announced additional restrictions on grain exports, enacting a partial ban effective March 15 through June 30. The move will further squeeze global wheat supplies at a time when Russia’s war with Ukraine is disrupting exports from the region.

event: Shell hit a 16-storey apartment block in Kyiv
Decription: At least five people were killed after a shell hit a 16-storey apartment block in the Sviatoshynskyi district of Kyiv, according to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Images shared on social media by the city’s mayor, Vitali Klitschko, showed the building engulfed in flames.

text: Mar, 16.The Russian Armed Forces bombed the Drama Theatre in Mariupol, Ukraine. It was used as an air raid shelter during the siege of Mariupol.
event: Mariupol theater airstrike
Decription: the Russian Armed Force bombed the Donetsk Regional Drama Theatre in Mariupol, Ukraine. It was used as an air raid shelter during the siege of Mariupol, sheltering a large number of civilians.

event: Russian attack killed 14 civilians in Chernihiv.
Decription: Russian attack killed 14 civilians in Chernihiv. Most of them were standing in line at a food store waiting for bread when a Russian air strike with eight unguided aerial bombs hit them

event: Russian missiles hit a plant on Lviv's outskirts in western Ukraine
Decription: The strike targeted a repair facility for fighter jets. Ukrainian officials said missiles were launched from the Black Sea. On Lviv's historic square, 109 empty strollers were lined up in a visual installation, representing children killed in the war.

event: Russian President Vladimir Putin made a rare public appearance at a stadium in Moscow
Decription: Russian President Vladimir Putin made a rare public appearance at a stadium in Moscow, packed with thousands of flag-waving people and banners reading "For Russia" and "For a World without Nazism." He praised Russian fighters in what he calls the "special military operation" in Ukraine, saying the effort had united the country.

text: Mar, 20. Russia bombs a Mariupol art school sheltering 400 civilians
event: Russian forces hit a shelter in Mariupol
Decription: Russia bombed an art school sheltering about 400 people. Russian military forces struck the school in the besieged city of Mariupol, Ukrainian officials said. Ongoing shelling in the southeastern port city has prevented civilians from safely evacuating. According to the UN, more than 900 civilians have died since the invasion started.

text: Mar, 21. A Russian court banned Facebook and Instagram for "extremist" activities. The ruling for parent company Meta excluded its messaging platform WhatsApp.
event: A Russian court banned Facebook and Instagram for "extremist" activities.
Decription: A Russian court banned Facebook and Instagram for "extremist" activities. The ruling for parent company Meta excluded its messaging platform WhatsApp, and the full scale of the impact remains unclear.

text: Mar, 21. Russian troops used stun grenades and gunfire to disperse a rally of pro-Ukrainian protesters in the occupied southern city of Kherson
event: Ukraine says Russian forces violently disperse Kherson protest
Decription: Ukraine's armed forces said Russian troops used stun grenades and gunfire to disperse a rally of pro-Ukrainian protesters in the occupied southern city of Kherson

text: Mar, 21. Vladimir Putin signs the law recognizing the participants of the special operation as veterans
event: Putin signs the law recognizing the participants of the special operation as veterans
Deadly shelling in Ukraine’s Kyiv flattens shopping mall
Decription: Russia has shelled houses and a shopping area in Kyiv’s Podil district, killing at least four people

text: Mar, 23. Russia orders gas payments in rubles by March 31
event: Russia orders gas payments in rubles by March 31
Decription: The Russian president on Monday instructed the government, central bank, and Gazprom company to switch to rubles by March 31 the payments for the deliveries of gas to “unfriendly countries.”

event: Kharkiv cluster bombing
Decription: Russian missile strike hit a shopping mall parking lot near the Akademika Pavlova metro station. At the time, hundreds of people were waiting outside a post office in the mall to obtain humanitarian aid. After the strike, the people panicked and ran away from the scene of the crime. A rocket strike by the Russian Armed Forces killed 6 civilians and wounded 15 more during the battle of Kharkiv

event: Russian forces attacked the western Ukrainian city of Lviv
Decription: Lviv, western Ukrainian city until now spared from Russian assault, rocked by powerful explosions. One of the strikes hit a fuel storage facility, causing it to catch fire, and a later strike caused "significant damage" to the city's infrastructure facilities, according to the city's mayor, Andriy Sadovyi.

event: Russian forces allegedly damaged another Holocaust memorial in Ukraine
Decription: Jewish groups have condemned a missile attack near a Holocaust memorial park in Kyiv, which commemorates the murder of Jews by the Nazis in World War Two. Babyn Yar was the site of one of the largest mass killings, where Jewish people were lined up and shot.

text: Mar, 28. G7 rejects Russia's demand to pay for gas in rubles
event: G7 rejects Russia's demand to pay for gas in rubles
Decription: The Group of Seven major economies have agreed to reject Moscow’s demand to pay for Russian natural gas exports in rubles, the German energy minister said Monday. Robert Habeck told reporters that “all G7 ministers agreed completely that this (would be) a one-sided and clear breach of the existing contracts” for natural gas, which is used to heat homes, generate electricity and power industry.

text: Mar, 29. Russia decided to "drastically reduce" military activity in the Kiev and Chernihiv directions.
event: Deputy Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation declared that Russia decided to drastically reduce military activity in the Kiev and Chernihiv directions.
Decription: Moscow says it will “drastically reduce military activity” on two fronts — Kyiv and Chernihiv — according to the Russian Ministry of Defense Telegram channel. Russian Deputy Defense Minister Alexander Fomin confirmed "to radically, at times, reduce military activity," according to state media RIA. The move follows talks between Russian and Ukrainian delegations in Istanbul on Tuesday.

event: Russian and Ukrainian negotiators meet in Istanbul.
Decription: Ukraine puts forward a detailed proposal of neutrality.

event: Russia-Ukraine war: Several killed in Mykolaiv attack
Decription: At least 12 were killed and 33 others wounded when a Russian rocket hit a regional government building in the southern Ukrainian port city, local authorities say. Mykolaiv, or Nikolaev, is a city near the Black Sea in southern Ukraine.

event: Chernobyl nuclear power plant returned to Ukrainian control
Decription:
On February 24, 2022, during the Russian invasion of Ukraine, she was captured by the Russian military. After the capture, the station turned out to be de-energized and switched to emergency temporary diesel generators. It has become impossible for the central authorities in Kyiv to remotely control the parameters of nuclear and radiation safety at the facility. Chernobyl, the site of the world's worst nuclear disaster, fell into the hands of Russian troops in the first week of the war in Ukraine, in late February. 

On March 31, Russian troops announced their intention to leave and handed over control to Ukrainian personnel. The plant is now back under the control of Ukrainian authorities.

С момента захвата на станции были блокированы 210 человек, из них 103 сотрудника станции и 4 сталкера, оказавшихся в тот день в зоне отчуждения.

event: Russia begin enforcing ruble payments for its natural gas exports
Decription: The Russian President’s decision to enforce rouble payments has boosted the Russian currency, which fell to historic lows after the February 24 invasion. “In order to purchase Russian natural gas, they must open rouble accounts in Russian banks. It is from these accounts that payments will be made for gas delivered starting from tomorrow,” Putin said in televised remarks.

text: Apr, 3.Ukrainian forces retaking control over the Kyiv region are reporting horrors from Bucha.
event: Bucha massacre.
Decription: Kyiv region was under control of russian trops from 5 till 30 March. After Ukrainian forces retaking control over, they find a lot of horrors include bodies of men who were apparently killed execution-style, some with their hands tied behind their backs. According to the mayor and other local authorities, approximately 1,300 bodies have been recovered from the town and surrounding areas, including 31 children. Ukrainian officials are urging third-party organizations such as the International Criminal Court to send investigators, and Human Rights Watch says it has documented several cases of apparent war crimes committed by Russian troops. Russia's defense ministry has denied the accusations and also called it "fakes".

event: Air raids rocked Ukraine's strategic Black Sea port Odesa
Decription: Air strikes rocked Ukraine’s strategic Black Sea port Odessa early Sunday morning, according to an interior ministry official

text: Apr, 6. Hungary ready to pay for Russian gas in rubles, says Viktor Orban
event: Hungary ready to pay for Russian gas in rubles, says Viktor Orban
Decription: Hungary said on Wednesday it was prepared to pay roubles for Russian gas, breaking ranks with the European Union which has sought a united front in opposing Moscow's demand for payment in the currency.

event: Bombing of Borodianka
Decription: The Russian Armed Forces completely destroyed Borodyanka near Kyiv. The town of Borodianka was bombed extensively by the Russian Armed Forces during the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine. On the territory of Borodyanka, as the chief of staff of the Ministry of Internal Affairs Denis Monastyrsky, there is not a single military facility, but the RF Armed Forces did not send and completely destroyed the settlement.

text: Apr, 8. Sanctions Wave #5 after Bucha: personal, coal, fertilizers, no gas payments in rubles, freezing assets, electronics and weapons export
event: Fifth round of sanctions introduced: Ban on imports of coal, exports of electronics and weapons to Russia, and payments for energy resources in rubles. Personal sanctions, cessation of interinstitutional cooperation. Freezing of bank assets.
Decription: In light of Russia’s continuing war of aggression against Ukraine, and the reported atrocities committed by Russian armed forces in Ukraine, the Council decided today to impose a fifth package of economic and individual sanctions against Russia.

text: Apr, 8. Russian fertilizers embargo with the fifth sanctions wave

event: Missile strike on Kramatorsk railway station
Decription: a Tochka missile struck a railway station in Kramatorsk, where up to 4,000 civilians, mostly women and children, were waiting to evacuate the city. Ukrainian officials accused Russia of carrying out the attack, and stated that between 98 and 300 civilians were wounded in the strike and at least 50 killed, including 5 children.

text: Apr, 10. Russian forces completely isolated Azovstal steel plant
event: The siege Azovstal started
Decription: The Ukrainian metallurgical plant Azovstal became a hotbed of resistance for the Ukrainian army in response to Russia's aggression against Ukraine. From the very beginning of the battles for Mariupol, a large number of people took refuge at the plant. As of April 20, 2022, the number of military personnel was approximately 3 thousand people, and civilians - at least 200. On April 10, more than a month after the start of the invasion, Russian forces completely isolated the Ukrainian military personnel remaining on the territory of the Azovstal plant, however, due to the fortification work carried out by the Ukrainian forces and the complex structure of Azovstal, the ground assault was greatly complicated

text: Apr, 11. EU confirms ban to end all Russian coal imports by 10 August
event: EU confirms ban to end all Russian coal imports by 10 August
Decription: All Russian coal and other solid fossil fuels imports to the EU must stop by 10 August under the bloc’s fifth package of sanctions against Russia in force since Saturday. Only contracts concluded before Saturday to buy, import or transfer Russian coal, directly or indirectly, and any contracts related to them, could continue until 10 August, the EU confirmed in its Official Journal late on Friday.

event: Ukrainian officials say at least 1,200 civilians have been killed in the Kyiv area.
Decription:
Ukraine's prosecutor general says the bodies of at least 1,200 civilians have been recovered around the capital, Kyiv. The office is also investigating possible war crimes.

Recovery efforts continue in the suburbs, cities and towns outside of Kyiv. Bodies are being found in basements and manholes and being recovered from destroyed buildings and homes.

Russia's troops have fully left the Kyiv region, moving back over the border into Belarus and Russia.

Ukraine is repositioning many of its troops to the east, but soldiers and officials whom NPR talked to say they're not leaving the capital undefended. There are lingering concerns that Russia could renew its attack on the region.

text: Apr, 12. A bill on the possibility of nationalising foreign companies that have left the Russian market has been sent to the Russian parliament.
Apr, 12. During a speech about surging inflation, US President Joe Biden appeared to accuse Russia's Vladimir Putin of genocide.
event: Biden accuses Russia of 'genocide' in Ukraine
The Russian warship Moskva, the flagship of the Russian Navy's Black Sea Fleet, sank
Decription: Russia’s Black Sea flagship missile cruiser, the Moskva, sank while being towed to port after an explosion caused by an unexplained fire, the Russian defence ministry has said, after Ukraine said it had hit the ship with a missile or missiles.

text: Apr, 15. Armenia started paying in rubles for Russian gas
event: Economy minister: Armenia has started paying in rubles for Russia natural gas
Decription: Armenia has started paying in Russian rubles for the Russian natural gas. The minister of economy of Armenia, Vahan Kerobyan, said this in an interview with RBC.

event: Kharkiv cluster bombing
Decription: n the afternoon hours, during the battle of Kharkiv, the Russian Army fired 9N210/9N235 cluster bombs into the Industrialnyi District, striking a residential area and a playground in the Myru Street. Nine civilians died and 35 were injured, including children.

event: The Russian Defense Ministry said on Sunday that it destroyed an ammunition factory near the city of Brovary, in the Kyiv region, overnight.
A Ukrainian photojournalist who had been missing since March 13 was found dead in a village north of Kyiv
Decription: A Ukrainian photojournalist who went missing last month in a combat zone near Kyiv has been found dead, Ukrainian officials confirm. Maks Levin, 40, was killed with two gunshots, allegedly fired by the Russian military. The office of Ukraine's prosecutor general said they found Levin's body in a village north of Kyiv on Friday.

event: Russian forces launch a new, large-scale offensive in east Ukraine to take full control of the Luhansk and Donetsk oblasts.

text: April,20. Russia tested new ballistic missile
event: Russia tested new new ballistic missile
Decription: Russian President Vladimir Putin announced Wednesday that his military successfully test-launched an intercontinental ballistic missile with the potential to carry a large nuclear payload

text: April, 22. U.S. Deputy Secretary of State Victoria Nuland said the United States is preparing to give HIMARS and M270 MLRS multiple launch rocket systems to Ukraine

event: Missile attack on Odesa
Decription: The missile strike hit a military facility and two residential buildings, killing eight civilians and wounding 18 or 20, according to Ukraine. Russia confirmed the attack stating the facility targeted was a logistic terminal at a military airfield that housed US and European weapons given to Ukraine.

event: Transniestria, a pro-Russian region in Moldova claims blasts hit a ministry and two radio masts, blaming Ukraine

text: Mar, 24. Russian forces have used tear gas and stun grenades to disperse a pro-Ukrainian rally in the occupied city of Kherson
event: Pro-Ukraine Rally Dispersed By Russians In Kherson After City Administration Forced Out

text: Apr, 27. Russia shuts off gas supplies to Poland and Bulgaria
event: Russia shuts off gas supplies to Poland and Bulgaria
Decription: Russian state energy giant Gazprom said in a statement Wednesday that it had fully halted supplies to Polish gas company PGNiG and Bulgaria’s Bulgargaz after they refused to meet a demand by Moscow to pay in rubles, rather than euros or dollars.

event: Russia cuts off gas flows to Bulgaria and Poland, allegedly for refusing to pay for gas in roubles.
Decription:
Mysterious explosions in Transnistria, a breakaway Russian-controlled territory in Moldova bordering on Ukraine, have raised fears that the Ukraine conflict may be spreading.

Separatist authorities said Ukrainian "infiltrators" were responsible. But Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has blamed Russian special services.

event: Russian forces attacked and destroyed the Zatoka bridge
Decription: Russian forces attacked and destroyed the Zatoka bridge with the aim of disconnect the city of Odesa with the rest of the country at the east of Dniester river.

event: Ukraine claims Russia fired two missiles into Kyiv during UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres visit to the war-torn country.
A series of blasts was heard in the early hours of Wednesday in the Russian city Belgorod near the Ukrainian border

text: May, 1. Evacuations for civilians were carry out from the Azovstal steel factory in Mariupol. Around 100 civilians was being evacuated.
event: Evacuation from Mariupol's Azovstal steelworks
Decription: More than 100 Ukrainian civilians evacuated from Mariupol's Azovstal steelworks.

event: Odesa airport runway ‘destroyed’
Decription: Russian forces destroyed the newly built runway of the Odesa Airport

text: May, 1. Ruble zone was introduced in Kherson region, the territory under control of Russian military
event: Ruble zone was introduced in Kherson region

text: May, 4. European Commission chief announces further Russia sanctions, including oil, banks, broadcasters
May, 5. EU announced 3 major Russian banks (inc. Sberbank) to be disconnected from SWIFT
event: EU announces removing the largest (Sberbank) and two major banks from Swift network
Odesa bombing
Decription: The city was bombed, with four missiles hitting a civilian building and another two on the city airport

event: a bomb strikes a village school in Bilohorivka
Decription: At least 60 people are feared dead after a bomb strikes a village school in Bilohorivka, eastern Ukraine

event: Russia fired three Kinzhal missiles to Odesa Oblast.
Decription: At that time, President of the European Council Charles Michel and Prime Minister of Ukraine Denys Shmyhal were in Odesa and had to hide in a bomb shelter. In the evening of the same day, Russian troops fired rockets at three warehouses in Odesa and a shopping centre in the village of Fontanka near the city. One person was killed, and two people were injured in the warehouses, and three people were injured in the mall.

text: May, 9. Victory Day. A holiday that commemorates the victory over Nazi Germany in 1945

event: Finland announces it will seek NATO membership

text: May, 17. Ukraine’s military declares the end to the Azovstal operation in Mariupol
event: Ukraine’s military declares an end to the Azovstal operation in Mariupol.

text: May,18. Finland and Sweden simultaneously handed in their official letters of application to join NATO
event: Finland and Sweden formally apply to join the NATO alliance.

text: May, 20. Russian army takes control of Mariupol’s Azovstal steel plant
event: Russian army takes control of Mariupol’s Azovstal steel plant
Decription: Military operations on the territory of the Mariupol metallurgical plant Azovstal and its environs took place as part of the battles for Mariupol during the Russian invasion of Ukraine from March 18 to May 20, 2022. On 16 May, Agreements were reached, according to which Ukrainian servicemen surrender, and the Russian side takes them out of the territory of Azovstal to the territory controlled by the DPR. On May 20,  the surrender of all Ukrainian servicemen

text: May, 21. Russia halts gas supplies to Finland
event: Russia halts gas supplies to Finland
Decription: Helsinki has been refusing to pay for its supplies in roubles. But the cut-off also follows an announcement that Finland will apply for Nato membership. Despite its invasion of Ukraine on 24 February, Russia continues to supply gas to many European countries.

text: May, 22. Cessation of Russian gas, oil, electricity imports by Lithuania
event: The cessation of gas imports from Russia by Lithuania
Decription: The Ministry of Energy of the Republic of Lithuania announced that from May 22, Lithuania will no longer receive gas, oil and electricity from Russia.

text: May, 23 Alexandr Lukashenko and Vladimir Putin met in Sochi
May, 24. Adoption in the first reading of the bill on the nationalization of assets of foreign companies
event: Adoption in the first reading of the bill on the nationalization of assets of foreign companies
Russian forces continue a slow encirclement of Severdonetsk, and are reportedly in possession of the northeastern portion of the city.
Decription: Ukrainian Deputy Defence Minister Anna Malyar says “fighting has reached its maximum intensity. The enemy is storming the positions of our troops in several directions simultaneously”.

text: May, 31. Russia halts gas supplies to Netherlands and some Danish and German companies
event: Russia cuts gas supplies to Netherlands and firms in Denmark and Germany
Russian forces occupy the centre of Severdonetsk as Ukrainian troops make a tactical retreat.
The EU bans Russian oil and petroleum products
Decription: The EU bans Russian oil and petroleum products, following a decision on a sixth package of sanctions against Russia. A temporary exception is made for pipeline oil, after the objections of landlocked countries that they could not easily supply themselves by sea.

text: Jun, 3. Sanctions Wave #6: oil, mass media, freezing assets, technologies
event: Sixth round of sanctions introduced: Partial oil embargo, banks disconnection from swift announced, banning of Russian mass media, technological, financial, consulting restrictions, freezing of bank assets.
Russian governor says Ukraine hits border village
Decription: Alexander Bogomaz, the Governor of Russia's Bryansk region, said that Ukrainian forces carried out strikes on a village in the region

text: Jun, 6. EU adopts new sanctions to de-SWIFT Russian and Belarusian banks
Jun,6. Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov cancelled visit to Serbia after countries around Serbia closed their airspace.
Jun,7. Former speaker of Poland Parlament offered to give a nuclear weapon to Ukraine.
event: No garanties for Finland and Sweden about Nuclear weapons + Sikorsky statment
According to the Kremlin, the traitors will “disappear on their own” in Russia.
Decription: The Kremlin was convinced that those who are considered traitors today will choose themselves and disappear from Russian society in the midst of tensions caused by Moscow's military operations in Ukraine, said Dmitri Peskov, a spokesman for the President of the Russian Federation

text: Jun, 24. The President of Belarus arrived in Russia on an informal visit
June, 25. Russian forces took control of the battered city of Severodonetsk in eastern Ukraine
event: Severodonetsk: Russia has full control of eastern city
Kremenchuk shopping mall attack
Decription: he Russian Armed Forces fired two Kh-22 anti-ship missiles into central Kremenchuk, Poltava Oblast, hitting the Amstor shopping mall and the Kredmash road machinery plant. A fire broke out and the attack killed at least 20 people and injured at least 56. Russian media and officials carried conflicting stories about the attack.

text: Jun, 28. Legalisation of "parallel imports" in russia
event: Putin signed a bill into law legalizing "parallel imports"
Decription: The law protects Russian companies that import certain categories of goods without the permission of the intellectual property owner, the so-called parallel imports, from possible civil, administrative and criminal liability.

text: Jun, 30. End of Russian Partial Ban on Grain Exports
event: End of Russian Partial Ban on Grain Exports
Russian Duma passes law on retaliation against foreign media
Decription: The lower house of the State Duma passed new laws allowing the Russian prosecutor-general to shut down foreign media from countries that have banned Russian media, due to bans on Russian media over the war in Ukraine.

event: Российские военные отступили с острова Змеинный
Odesa oblast bombing
Decription: three Kh-22 missiles fired from Tu-22M strategic bombers were fired into a 9-store apartment building and an recreational center in the settlement Serhiivka, Bilhorod-Dnistrovskyi Raion, Odesa Oblast. The whole section of the apartment building was destroyed. At least 21 people were killed and more than 38 wounded.

text: Jul, 1. In July 2022, Nord Stream AG will temporarily close both lines of its pipeline for planned maintenance work

Decription: Two Britons, Andrew Hill and Dylan Healy, were charged by the Donetsk People's Republic as being mercenaries, the same charge that two other Britons, Shaun Pinner and Aiden Aslin, were convicted of in June and sentenced to death for

event: хлопки в белгороде

text: July, 3. Ukrainian forces withdrew from Lysychansk, a city in the Sievierodonetsk Raion of the Luhansk Oblast
event: Ukrainian troops left Lisichansk
Reported that Russian forces arranged a military base in the complex by deploying heavy self-propelled multiple rocket launcher BM-30 Smerch inside Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Station
Igor Konashenkov, the Russian defence ministry's chief spokesman, said that Russian air-launched high precision missiles had destroyed two U.S.-supplied HIMARS systems in Ukraine
Decription: The Ukrainian military denied the claim, calling it "nothing more than a fake".[645] The Russian military released video allegedly showing the attack, but it could not be independently verified

event: Putin says Russia just starting in Ukraine, peace talks will get harder
Decription: "Today we hear that they want to defeat us on the battlefield. What can you say, let them try. We have heard many times that the West wants to fight us to the last Ukrainian. This is a tragedy for the Ukrainian people, but it seems that everything is heading towards this. Everyone should know that, by and large, we haven't started anything yet in earnest. At the same time, we don't reject peace talks. But those who reject them should know that the further it goes, the harder it will be for them to negotiate with us." Mykhailo Podolyak, the Ukrainian chief negotiator, wrote on Twitter in response: "There is no 'collective West' plan. Only a specific z-army which entered sovereign Ukraine, shelling cities and killing civilians. Everything else is a primitive propaganda. That's why Mr. Putin's mantra of the 'war to the last Ukrainian' is yet another proof of deliberate Russian genocide."

event: The governor of the Mykolaiv Oblast, Vitaly Kim, claimed that Russia had been using the surface-to-air S-300 missile system in a surface-to-surface capacity.
Missile strike on Chasiv Yar
Decription: A missile strike on two residential buildings in Chasiv Yar by the Russian army was carried out at 21:17 local time on 9 July 2022. 47 people were found dead under the rubble, and 9 wounded were rescued. Due to the impact, a five-story residential building partially collapsed.

event: Shelling of Kharkiv
Decription: The mayor Ihor Terekhov said that the areas shelled were residential area with "no military significance", including several civilian houses, stores, a tire repair store, and a school. Reuters confirmed that at least one residential structure had been hit. Authorities said that six civilians had died, including a 17-year old teenager and his father

event: North Korea recognised the independence of the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and the Luhansk People's Republic (LPR)
Decription: Ukraine to introduce sanctions against the North Korean government.

event: A missile strike in Vinnytsia killed 26 people.
Decription:
Over 90 innocent civilians were injured in the Russian rocket attack, which also hit a hospital, shopping mall, and damaged numerous residential buildings. 50 vehicles were also set ablaze in the shopping mall car park, with footage circulating on social media platforms showing thick black smoke filling the sky. 26 people are now confirmed to have died, including three children.

Russia's defence ministry said Thursday's cruise missile strike on the Ukrainian city of Vinnytsia was directed at a building where top officials from Ukraine's armed forces were meeting foreign arms suppliers.

event: Russia started a "volunteer mobilisation". The Wagner Group also started recruiting prisoners.
Ukraine claimed that Russia was using the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Station to store weapons, and as a base from which to fire them

text: Jul, 18. The Financial Times reported on the plans of the speaker of US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi to visit Taiwan

event: Himars missiles strike key Russian-held bridge in Kherson
Decription: A Ukrainian missile strike has damaged a key bridge linking the Russian-occupied city of Kherson with the heavily militarised Russia-controlled Crimea, potentially disrupting further reinforcements.

text: Jul, 21. Sanctions Wave #7: gold, personal, technologies
event: Seventh round of sanctions introduced: Ban on operations with Russian gold, personal, technological sanctions
Kharkiv shelling
The CEO of Metinvest, the company that owns the Azovstal iron and steel works, accused Russia of taking £500 million worth of steel from Ukraine
Russia and Ukraine signed a U.N. and Turkey-brokered deal to free grain exports blockaded by Russia in Ukraine's Black Sea ports
Russia fires missiles at Odesa port hours after signing grain export deal
Decription: less than a day after signing a grain export deal with Ukraine, Russia launched Kalibr missiles at the Odesa sea trade port. According to Ukraine, two of the four missiles were intercepted. Russian officials told Turkey that Russia had "nothing to do" with the missile strike

event: Russian's Defence Ministry claims to have destroyed 100 HIMARS missiles in a strike on Dnipropetrovsk. Reuters couldn't independently verify this claim.
Decription: The claim is now of over 50 Ukrainian POWs killed, including captured members of the Azov Regiment at Mariupol. Russia claimed the prison was hit with HIMARS missiles and offered fragments of the rocket as proof. Ukraine is asking the UN and Red Cross to investigate.

text: Jul, 27. Russia has reduced gas supplies via the Nord Stream 1 pipeline by 20%

event: An explosion occurred at Olenivka prison, killing, according to RIA, 40 captured Ukrainian POWs and wounding 75. Ukraine's General Staff stated that the strike was committed by Russia to hide the torture and executions of Ukrainian prisoners of war.
Decription: Russian energy giant Gazprom says it has suspended gas supplies to Latvia - the latest EU country to experience such action amid tensions over Ukraine. Gazprom accused Latvia of violating conditions of purchase, but gave no details of that alleged violation.

text: Jul, 30. Gazprom stops Latvia's gas in latest Russian cut to EU
event: Gazprom stops Latvia's gas in latest Russian cut to EU
